Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Distal and Standard Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass in Patients with BMI 50–60 kg/m²

Trial_Design.evidence: In this double-blind, parallel-group RCT, 123 patients aged 20–60 years with a BMI of 50–60 kg/m² were randomised

Participants.evidence: 123 patients aged 20–60 years with a BMI of 50–60 kg/m² were randomised

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive either standard RYGB (150 cm alimentary limb) or distal RYGB (150 cm common channel)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was change in BMI at 2 years.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using permuted-block randomization with allocation concealment.

Blinding.evidence: Patients, outcome assessors, and the statistician were blinded.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 123 patients aged 20–60 years with a BMI of 50–60 kg/m² were randomised

Number_Analysed.evidence: Of 113 patients who received an intervention, 92 attended the 5-year follow-up.

Result_Outcome.evidence: BMI reduction was 15.1 kg/m² (95% CI 13.9 to 16.2) for standard RYGB and 15.7 kg/m² (14.5 to 16.9) for distal RYGB, with a between-group difference of -0.64 kg/m² (P = 0.447).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events included repeat abdominal surgery in 28% of standard and 18% of distal RYGB patients.

Funding.evidence: Funding: South-Eastern Norway Regional Health Authority and Alexander Malthes Foundation.
